android-cloexec-accept4.description:
Description

accept4()
should include
SOCK_CLOEXEC
in its type argument to avoid the
file descriptor leakage. Without this flag, an opened sensitive file would
remain open across a fork+exec to a lower-privileged SELinux domain.

Examples:

accept4
(
sockfd
,
addr
,
addrlen
,
SOCK_NONBLOCK
);
// becomes
accept4
(
sockfd
,
addr
,
addrlen
,
SOCK_NONBLOCK
|
SOCK_CLOEXEC
);
android-cloexec-accept4.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
